page.title: 01CROCKHAM HILL (WEST KENT)
page.content: The village Crockham Hill lies three miles to the south of Westerham and the block surveyed extends across the dense beech woodland and coarse common land of Brasted Chart and Toys Hill. This latter is a ridge of greesand hills extending along the north side of the weald, and Toys Hill is at an elevation of 250 metres. There is considerable residential property on the borders of the woodland. The area has mention in the Domesday Book of 1086 as having "Pannage for hogs" and was only enclosed by the Enclosures Act of 1853. Crockham Hill churchyard is the burial place of Octavia Hill, founder of the National Trust, who lived at Toys Hill. The block also contains Chartwell which was the former home of Winston Churchill. Large areas of the rectangle are now the property of the National Trust and
